channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1928 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1928 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: 'The Yards'
item.description: The evolution of the ‘Yards’ from the days of the Clybournes and the Myricks is evidenced by this view of the cattle pens taken in 1928. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: 1928 Automobile Accident
item.description: Group of men standing on a sidewalk and in the street, looking at the wrecked automobile of Ainslee Lambert. Courtesy of the Chicago Historical Society. Other images from this year

item.title: Anna Sheridan, a Policewoman
item.description: Three-quarter length portrait of police matron Anna Sheridan of the Chicago Police Department, looking toward the camera, standing in a room in a police station in Chicago, Illinois, dark exposure. Several doorways are visible in the background. Courtesy of the Chicago Historical Society. Other images from this year

item.title: Clown with Children
item.description: Informal group portrait of a clown sitting with a group of children in a room in Chicago, Illinois, next to a large clock. Text on the face of the clock reads: The Fire Clock. The children and the clown are holding toy dolls, and some of the children are sitting and some are standing. Courtesy of the Chicago Historical Society. Other images from this year

item.title: Member of the American Women's Field Hockey Team
item.description: Members of the American women’s field hockey team kneeling and standing in two rows on a grass field. Courtesy of the Chicago Historical Society. Other images from this year
